bratty.gloss: (used of an ill-mannered child) impolitely unruly

brawny.gloss: (of a person) possessing physical strength and weight

breathless.gloss: not breathing or able to breathe except with difficulty
tending to cause suspension of regular breathing

breathtaking.gloss: tending to cause suspension of regular breathing

breezy.gloss: abounding in or exposed to the wind or breezes

briary.gloss: having or covered with protective barbs or quills or spines or thorns or setae etc.

briery.gloss: having or covered with protective barbs or quills or spines or thorns or setae etc.

bright-red.gloss: of the red of fresh raspberries

bright blue.gloss: of a deep somewhat purplish blue color similar to that of a clear October sky

brilliant.gloss: having or marked by unusual and impressive intelligence

brinded.gloss: having a grey or brown streak or a pattern or a patchy coloring

brindle.gloss: having a grey or brown streak or a pattern or a patchy coloring

brindled.gloss: having a grey or brown streak or a pattern or a patchy coloring

brine-cured.gloss: (used especially of meats) preserved in salt

bristled.gloss: having or covered with protective barbs or quills or spines or thorns or setae etc.

bristly.gloss: having or covered with protective barbs or quills or spines or thorns or setae etc.

broad.gloss: having great (or a certain) extent from one side to the other
being at a peak or culminating point
very large in expanse or scope

broad-leafed.gloss: having relatively broad rather than needlelike or scalelike leaves

broad-leaved.gloss: having relatively broad rather than needlelike or scalelike leaves

broadband.gloss: responding to or operating at a wide band of frequencies

broadleaf.gloss: having relatively broad rather than needlelike or scalelike leaves

broadnosed.gloss: of or related to New World monkeys having nostrils far apart or to people with broad noses

brobdingnagian.gloss: unusually great in size or amount or degree or especially extent or scope

brocaded.gloss: embellished with a raised pattern created by pressure or embroidery

broiled.gloss: cooked by radiant heat (as over a grill)

broken.gloss: subdued or brought low in condition or status
(especially of promises or contracts) having been violated or disregarded
thrown into a state of disarray or confusion
out of working order (`busted' is an informal substitute for `broken')

broken-backed.gloss: (of a ship) so weakened as to sag at each end

bromidic.gloss: dull and tiresome but with pretensions of significance or originality

bronzed.gloss: (of skin) having a tan color from exposure to the sun

brotherlike.gloss: like or characteristic of or befitting a brother

brotherly.gloss: like or characteristic of or befitting a brother

brown-haired.gloss: having hair of a dark color

brown-purple.gloss: of dark purple tinted with brown

brownish.gloss: of a color similar to that of wood or earth

brownish-purple.gloss: of dark purple tinted with brown

brownish-red.gloss: of dark brownish to purplish red

brownish-yellow.gloss: of a medium to dark brownish yellow color

brumal.gloss: characteristic of or relating to winter

brumous.gloss: filled or abounding with fog or mist

brushed.gloss: (of fabrics) having soft nap produced by brushing

brushy.gloss: covered with or consisting of bushes or thickets

brusk.gloss: marked by rude or peremptory shortness

brusque.gloss: marked by rude or peremptory shortness

brutal.gloss: (of persons or their actions) able or disposed to inflict pain or suffering

breadthways.gloss: in the direction of the breadth

breadthwise.gloss: in the direction of the breadth

broadly.gloss: without regard to specific details or exceptions

broadly speaking.gloss: without regard to specific details or exceptions

broadwise.gloss: in the direction of the breadth
